eng/2017_29.title: The Church in Rome and in Corinth

one.title: Day 1: Review of Romans 15:14-23: Paul’s Ministry and Plans
one.mainTruth: God allows people to share in His work
principles: Successful Christian workers submit to God’s plans, place and time.
Successful Christian workers embrace giving and receiving.

questions.text: What work has God called you to do, and how have you prayerfully embraced it with obedience and joy?

two.title: Day 2: Read Romans 16:1-16.
two.description: Paul commends his many fellow workers

questions.text: Which of the people in these verses interests you most? Why?
What do you learn from these verses about men and women working in the Church?

three.title: Day 3: Read Romans 16:17-20.
three.description: Paul warns the Romans of divisive and deceptive people

questions.text: How can you recognize divisive and deceptive people?
Describe a person today who is “wise about what is good and innocent about what is evil.”

four.title: Day 4: Read Romans 16:20-25.
four.description: Paul sends greetings of other fellow workers

questions.text: What did Paul say about Timothy, Tertius, Gaius and Erastus?
What complimentary things could you say about your family members, pastor or Sunday school teacher? Will you take time to say thank you to each one this week?
For what did Paul give glory to God?
How will you give glory to God for all He has done in history and in your life this year?

six.title: Day 6: Review Romans 16.
six.description: Paul gave Romans greetings, commendations, warnings and glory to God

questions.text: How can you be wise about what is good and innocent about what is evil so that you can warn others?
To whom could you express your confidence in God’s ability to establish you by the gospel?
